author: ralexstokes
content:
**ACDC Recap**

* Clarified handling of fork digest in gossip topics for exits, now that their signatures are locked to an earlier fork
* Discussed the recent network outage due to interactions with Bloxroute’s relay and BDN
* Reviewed included Electra EIPs to agree to an initial scope for `pectra-devnet-0`
  * 6110: mostly ready, may rework pending deposits to simplify processing on-chain
  * 7002: updates outstanding for the predeploy to handle partial withdrawals; updates to the EIP and Engine API to follow that
  * 7251: core is in place, two big questions: (1) custom ceilings for setting a “withdrawable balance”, (2) EL-initiated consolidations (which would touch 7002). Both of these require further community input to assess demand and find right trade-off for resulting complexity. Keep an eye out for a breakout room to discuss further!
  * 7549: mostly ready, may update to make on-chain aggregation more flexible for better packing efficiency
* Discussed client implementation status of the above EIPs
  * Each client has a different subset of the EIPs implemented to varying degrees. Client’s top focus over the coming month(s)!
* Discussed other EIPs to include aside from the above in an initial Electra scope
  * Inclusion lists came up, still some uncertainty around interactions with AA; expect to discuss further on next ACDE
* Called out an initial electra PR for the `consensus-specs`: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3615. Expect the above to be reflected here soon, and test vectors along the way!
* Wrapped the call with a discussion on PeerDAS
  * there has been good progress on spec and initial work on implementation
  * we touched on potential networking complexities that would bar a “progressive” rollout and will wait for further mainnet data to find the next best steps for data scaling in Electra
